text: Lewisham is a National Rail and Docklands Light Railway (DLR) station in Lewisham, south-east London. It first opened in 1849. On the National Rail network it is measured from and is operated by Southeastern.Southeastern -Station facilities: Lewisham Lewisham is the southern terminus of the DLR, the previous station being Elverson Road. It is on the boundary of Travelcard Zone 2 and Zone 3. It is a major transport hub, with many buses passing through or terminating here. ==References== Category:Docklands Light Railway stations Category:Transport in the London Borough of Lewisham
title: Lewisham station
